Description: Lip sherd of Attic pottery Gordion cup; wholly glazed save for reserved band at rim inside; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.324, 1888,0601.426, 1948,0815.3 and 1948,0815.4. See Hirayama, H. 2010 Kleitias and Attic Black-figure Vases in the Sixth Century B.C., 233, A18, pl. 26.
Bibliographic references: Brijder Siana III 2000 / Siana Cups III: The Red-black Painter, Griffin-bird Painter, and Siana Cups resembling Lip-cups (p. 556, no. G3) (Ergotimos-Kleitias Group)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 381, no. B534)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 231, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0416) (Phase 1)
